title: Create a proposal from an optimization record
content:
When an optimization record is closed, you can create a proposal from this record when the recommended cloud solution is worth implementing and investigating.

After you create a proposal from an optimization record, Service Management automatically creates a relationship between the records. The proposal appears in the Related proposals tab.

Note Data domain assignments aren't copied when you create a proposal from an optimization record. For more information about data domains, see Data domain segmentation.

To create a proposal from an optimization record:

Prerequisite: Make sure the optimization record is in the Complete phase.

  1. From the main menu, select Plan > Application Portfolio > Optimizations.

  2. Select the optimization record from which you want to create a proposal.

    To filter the record list, click the Add filterÂ  button. For more information, see Filters.

  3. Click the record identifier in the Id column to display the selected record.

  4. At the top of the record form, click Create proposal.

    The New proposal page is displayed. The proposal title is prefilled.

  5. In Proposal details and Classifications sections, complete the required fields.

    For details of the field descriptions, refer to How to create a proposal.

  6. In Attachments, add any supporting files by clicking Add.

    Note

    • The supported attachment file formats and the maximum file size of an attachment are defined in the tenant's Application settings tab in Suite Administration.

    • If the Attachments field has been defined as encrypted for this record type and you are a member of an encryption domain, click Add encrypted attachments to attach an encrypted file to the record.

    • Attachments aren't visible in the Service Portal.

  7. Click Save when you are finished.
